intro: Perityle rosei, commonly known as the pink perityle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in umbels. Perityle rosei thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
